In economics, inflation is a sustained increase in the general price level of goods and services in an economy over a period of time. When the general price level rises, each unit of currency buys fewer goods and services. Consequently, inflation reflects a reduction in the purchasing power per unit of money - a loss of real value in the medium of exchange and unit of account within the economy. A long sustained period of inflation is caused by money supply growing faster than the rate of economic growth. Inflation may also lead to an invisible tax in which the value of currency is lowered in contrast with its actual reserve, ultimately leading individuals to hold devalued legal tender.

In economics, inflation is a sustained increase in the general price level of goods and services in an economy over a period of time. When the general price level rises, each unit of currency buys fewer goods and services. Consequently, inflation reflects a reduction in the purchasing power per unit of money - a loss of real value in the medium of exchange and unit of account within the economy. A long sustained period of inflation is caused by money supply growing faster than the rate of economic growth. Inflation may also lead to an invisible tax in which the value of currency is lowered in contrast with its actual reserve, ultimately leading individuals to hold devalued legal tender.

Hyperinflation is very high and typically accelerating inflation. It quickly erodes the real value of the local currency, as the prices of all goods increase. This causes people to minimize their holdings in that currency as they usually switch to more stable foreign currencies. Hyperinflation is often associated with some stress to the government budget, such as wars or their aftermath, sociopolitical upheavals, a collapse in export prices, or other crises that make it difficult for the government to collect tax revenue.

Laissez-faire philosophies, such as minimizing the role of government intervention and taxation in the free markets, and the idea that an "invisible hand" guides supply and demand are among the key ideas Adam Smith's writing is responsible for promoting. Our trade policies are largely inspired by him.

The Orthodox school of economic thought, also known as the French Liberal School or Optimist School, voraciously defends free trade and laissez-faire capitalism. They are the primary opponents of collectivist, interventionist and protectionist ideas. Our trade policies are largely inspired by this school.

Mercantilism is a type of policy designed to maximize the trade of a nation and especially to maximize the accumulation of gold and silver. It promotes governmental regulation of a nation's economy for the purpose of augmenting state power at the expense of rival national powers.

The aim of this policy is to have a country that is economically independent and nationally self-sufficient. It favors policies that emphasize domestic control of the economy, labor, and capital formation, even if this requires the heavy imposition of tariffs and other restrictions on the movement of labor, goods and capital.

Political Machines are a party organization, headed by a single boss or small autocratic group, that commands enough votes to maintain political and administrative control of a city, county, or state. It is in essence the bribery of mainly minorities by politicians using their influence. It is common to use the appointment for government jobs as a means of bribery within this system.

The spoils system (also known as a patronage system) is a practice in which a political party, after winning an election, gives government jobs to its supporters, friends and relatives as a reward for working toward victory, and as an incentive to keep working for the party - as opposed to a merit system, where offices are awarded on the basis of some measure of merit, independent of political activity.
If the crime fighting institutions in a province became overstretched, instigators would run amok and eventually gather sufficient attention and support to cause an impact in the established order.

Kleptocracy is a term applied to a government seen as having a particularly severe and systemic problem with officials or a ruling class (collectively, kleptocrats) taking advantage of corruption to extend their personal wealth and political power. Typically this system involves the embezzlement of state funds at the expense of the wider population, sometimes without even the pretense of honest service. Lacking sufficient control institutions in a country where external oversight is impossible or does not exist can mean that the bureaucrats would become kleptocrats.

A caudillo is a type of militia leader with a charismatic personality and enough of a populist program of generic future reforms to gain broad sympathy, at least at the outset, among the common people. Since the caudillo typically held power by controlling a patronage network that brooked no rival structure, some caudillos took up an anti-clerical stand. Many of the caudillos used their newly gained power, which was unchecked because it was extra-constitutional, to promote their own wealth and interests.

Agricultural production has expanded 16 times, three times more than population growth.

The Organic Statute of the Kingdom of Poland was a constitution introduced in the Kingdom of Poland after the suppression of the Polish Uprising of 1830-31 to replace the Constitution of 1815. It was promulgated in St. Petersburg by Tsar Nicholas I on Feb. 14 (26), 1832. Although the Organic Statute abolished the Sejm and the Polish Army, it preserved such autonomous institutions as the vicegerency, the State Council, and the vicegerent's Administrative Council.

Dr. Francia, dictator for life of Paraguay, inspired by French revolutionary ideals sought to create a utopian state based on Rosseau's Social Contract. Although he strived for equality of the people, Francia ruthlessly destroyed any opposition and created a Police state, imprisoning all those he deemed seditious. An isolationist, he ran the country with almost no outside influence.

Dentoudou, or "the way of tradition," is a government-sanctioned policy to protect traditional aspects of Japanese society and culture from Western influence. Its enforcement is vaguely defined, but the result is a Japan almost frozen in time culturally. Locals wear kimono, fashion their hair in the samurai chonmage style, live in homes invariably with Sino-Japanese architecture, and consume traditional Japanese media. Meanwhile, Japan's government and military structures are Westernized, and its technology and industry are advancing rapidly.

The West expresses curiosity and appreciation for our culture and society, frequently showing inspiration from it in their own artwork. This has allowed Japan to reach a level of prestige unprecedented among Eastern nations worldwide, defeating some negative impressions held toward us on account of us not being Westerners. Japanese culture has the potential to take the world by storm.

The Japanese emperor has officially been relegated to a ceremonial position, without any true power. This has been taken as a last resort to prevent the Emperor from ever building a coalition behind him to take over the government.
We cannot change our prime minister so often, as it causes a fragile government.
We have abolished the Imperial Examination, and now our examinations are done by foreign officers.
We are reforming our institutions to become the Danubian Federation.
With a modern revived form of Hebrew serving as our official and vernacular language, we are uniting Jews across all cultural and linguistic backgrounds into a new Israelite society.

Bach's reforms of the Austrian armed forces have led to a much-increased focus on a standing army and the development of prepared barracks, to the notable detriment of stockpiles of reserve equipment and industry.
Bach's reforms of the police have led to a successful unit of secret police, capable of putting down much unwanted discourse., despite their severe lack of popularity.

The French aristocracy has begun attempting to reestablish itself across the French state, seeking to bring back the days of feudalism before the Revolution began. They are supported by a deeply traditionalist court system, but their efforts are both deeply unpopular and wreaking havok on our administration. §YWe will need advancements in power, mechanization and mining to be able to finally resolve the issue.§!
The French monarchy has begun purging the military of liberal sympathies and Bonapartistes in an effort to restore royalist loyalty in the armed forces.

The Royal Legion is the new body of the French Military, an army greatly reduced in size but now reformed into a Prussian disciplinarian model. While the army may never be able to mobilize public support, the support of the army for the ruling monarchy will never be questioned in our lifetimes.

The Bourbon monarchy has solidified itself as a distinctly totalizing force, bringing France under a true form of absolutism it has not seen since the days before the Revolution, if ever it has been seen before. Any who oppose the monarchs are quickly silenced, and the Ultraroyalistes are the ruling power of France.
The formation of the Bourbon Empire has destroyed the European balance of power, drawing the ire of the other powers.

The French Monarchy has established itself as distinctly...moderate. The monarchy, while retaining its power, has decidedly avoided choosing between an absolutist approach and a liberal approach. Nobody is happy with this.
What do you mean 'if you can't beat them, join them?' My liege, what are you doing?

The Bourbon Monarchy has solved the land crisis in France by affirming the rights of the nobility to the land, while modernizing the outdated and convoluted legal structures in order to prevent further upending of the status quo.

Distributism is an economic ideology wherein private ownership of land is considered a natural right, and therefore posits that the government's role in the economy is to promote exclusively small businesses and engage in antitrust measures. As such, it is a highly agrarian ideology.

The Marotist faction of government has made itself known through successful military and officer corps reforms, bringing the armed forces to the forefront of modernity for a time, and as a side effect improving the education system.

The Fueros were a series of regional protections, governing bodies, and laws kept in place since the inheritance of these realms by Castille and Aragon. As long as the Carlists are in power, these legal reforms will be kept in place one way or another.

Our populace [re: the aristocracy] has benefitted greatly from our recent raids.

The Fueros Issue has remained unresolved, becoming progressively more embarrassing for our nation's standing worldwide and for our general populace as the perception of our nation's status as an underdeveloped backwater grows ever more prevalent.

Distributism is an economic ideology wherein private ownership of land is considered a natural right, and therefore posits that the government's role in the economy is to promote exclusively small businesses and engage in antitrust measures. As such, it is a highly agrarian ideology.
The Palace of Versailles is being reconstructed, despite much protest from ''economists'' and ''starving peasants'' who say it wastes too much of the budget.

With the reconstruction of the palace of Versailles, the court culture of the palace is recovering, bringing the intrigue and diplomatic weight of French wealth back to the forefront of European politics and diplomacy. And the peasants? Oh, dont worry, they have cake too.

The region of Fombina, meaning south, was ruled by a number of lamidos under the Adama, a Lamido which lead the Sokoto flag and centralized them at the plains of Adamawa. Our state depends upon the Sokoto Caliphate, but enjoys increasing autonomy, being able to declare its own jihads to convert native populations. We though have to pay tribute to them, and may not freely declare war to greater powers than our own, as we might be left to our own accord.

The region of Gwandu, centered on the cities of Kebbi and Gwandu, was ruled by the family of the brother of Usman dan Fodio, who were ceded the Emirate to govern it effectively as a separate Emirate, although under allegiance to the Sokoto Caliphate. Our state depends upon the Sokoto Caliphate, but enjoys increasing autonomy, being able to declare its own jihads to convert native populations. We though have to pay tribute to them, and may not freely declare war to greater powers than our own, as we might be left to our own accord.

Ilorin rules over the north of Yorubaland, and has been Muslim since the Sokoto jihad inspired one in the Oyo Empire and made northern control collapse. Our state depends upon the Sokoto Caliphate, but enjoys increasing autonomy, being able to declare its own jihads to convert native populations. We though have to pay tribute to them, and may not freely declare war to greater powers than our own, as we might be left to our own accord.

The region of Mandara had numerous non-Muslim tributaries and was part of the border with Fombina, against whom numerous battles were fought, with our fortifications in the Mandara Mountains holding their attacks and their push to Lake Chad. We are in debt to the Bornu for their support and to converve our non-Muslim tributaries, thus we depend upon Bornu, but enjoy increasing autonomy, being able to declare our own wars - but we have to pay tribute to them, and may not freely declare war to greater powers than our own, as we might be left to our own accord.

The current Maravi Confederation consists of 3 main states, one of them being Undi centered on Maano. They were the dominant state until the 1810s and the ones who broke the original balance of power inside the confederation.

The current Maravi Confederation consists of 3 main states, one of them being Kanyenda centered on Nkhotakota. They were the rulers of the northern territories in the 18th century, but we've since stripped them of their western lands.
The East of our country is being raided by the Yao, formed by the peoples that live to our northeast and east, which is making the local economy collapse.
Due to the current reforms of the government, the state's bureaucracy has been seemingly irrevocably damaged, plagued with inefficiencies and corruption.
This modifier prevents you from cheating with the island wargoal events.

The Papacy has convened an Ecumenical Council, reaffirming and reinforcing the doctrine of Papal Supremacy in the Catholic Church. Already, the bishops of the church across the Catholic world and beyond work to spread the power of the Vicar of Christ.

An unglamourous Papal Bull, but perhaps more important than any other. The clergy of the Papacy has been expanded, with more funding dedicated to the various holy orders under the command of the church, dedicating themselves to the mission of spreading literacy and the faith to the whole of the world.

The Papacy has convened an Ecumenical Council, reaffirming and strengthening the doctrine of Papal infallibility. Already, many of the clergy within the church are being weaponized into the hands of the Papal government, being used to spread the message day and night of the divine right and power of the Vicar of Christ.

A...crusade has been called, ill-defined as its goals may be, and the state has taken this as exceptional consideration to justify wars against those infidels on far-off shores, and equally those on the continent.
